title: Drawing, "Design for an Illustration: "Architecture"", 1760–89
medium: Brush and gray wash on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and black ink
signed: Inscribed in graphite Fischetti; upper center
inscribed:
Inscribed in pen and brown ink lower right corner Dr? 2
Stamp MB in blue lower left verso
Verso pen black ink; decorative swag?
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Standing among remains of classical architecture, a woman points at a plan held by two putti. She carries instruments for measurement in her left hand. A third putto measures a capital. Bordering line. 
Verso: fragment of a design; pencil, pen. Volutes are connected by intertwined bands.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for an Illustration: "Architecture"", 1760–89.
1760–89. Brush and gray wash on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and black ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6454.
